examples.text: We were all suffering in the **intense heat**.
The President is under **intense pressure** to resign.
His business affairs have been under **intense scrutiny**.
He was startled by the intense blue of her eyes.

definitions.definition: serious and often involving a lot of action in a short period of time

examples.text: There is **intense competition** for the top jobs.
It was a period of intense activity.
There has been intense speculation about divisions in the party.
It was a period of intense debate.

definitions.definition: having or showing very strong feelings, opinions or thoughts about somebody/something

examples.text: He was a softly-spoken, intense man.
There was an intense relationship between mother and son.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin intensus ‘stretched tightly, strained’, past participle of intendere ‘intend, extend, direct’, from in- ‘towards’ + tendere ‘stretch, tend’.
